intro: Cymbalaria acutiloba, commonly known as the sharp-leaved figwart, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Cymbalaria acutiloba is a perennial herb that is native to Europe and parts of Asia.
